title: Carrhouse railway station
text:
Carrhouse railway station, also known as Carr House railway station, served the area of Carrhouse, <a href="County%20Durham">County Durham</a>, England, from 1858 to 1868 on the <a href="Stanhope%20and%20Tyne%20Railway">Stanhope and Tyne Railway</a>.
History.
The station opened on 1 July 1858 by the <a href="North%20Eastern%20Railway%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">North Eastern Railway</a>. It was a short-lived station, closing 10 years later on 1 October 1868.
